title: Champion Update: Ashe takes aim at PBE

replies.body: i got to say i actually like this i really hate ashe {{champion:22}}  and what they doing i might actually play her ( riot finally {{champion:64}}  to me ) ty

How is Ashe's passive going to react with Hurricane? will the extra damage proc on each target slowed?

additionally, when she goes into full focus mode, will the extra focus attacks also trigger off at every target hit?

If so. She is going to be a teamfighting god....

The extra arrows from Ranger's Focus will likely work in the same way as Lulu's Glitter Lance, they may pass through units though, idk.
That would be a simple way to avoid the obvious OP factor of Hurricane Ashe. 

As far as the slow/damage application on the Hurricane bolts, according to how it is worded, the slow only applies to units who are *damaged* by Ashe's basic attacks and abilities. So the slow aspect of her passive shouldn't apply to Hurricane bolts.
However, if a Hurricane bolt hits an enemy who is *slowed* it will apply the bonus damage from her passive, because this is an *on-hit* effect.


It all balances out really nicely actually. I'm impressed Rito.

Yeah, but {{item:3085}} applies {{champion:29}}, {{champion:17}}  and {{champion:110}} passives so why wouldn't it apply {{champion:22}}  passive? By the looks of it RH is going to be core item for once xD

I agree. 
It also works with Kalista's on hit ability, stacking the spears in every target it hits.

the hurricane extra attacks appear to count as basic attacks, pretty sure they give 3 stacks of Caitlyn's passive as well

> {{champion:22}}'s new passive will be applied by {{item:3085}}, however her new Q's active will not.

Actually Runaan's will fire 2 bolts each for all 5 arrows in Flurry for 10 bolts in total, however only the first arrows and its 2 bolts will apply on-hit effects aside from her passive slow. The damage of each bolt will also be about a fifth of a normal bolt and won't crit even byher passive, the total damage Runaan's would do is either 50% AD or 57.5%-67.5% AD depending if it's based off total AD or normal Q damage (not sure which it is).

So really it won't be that effective on her unless it is based off the normal Q damage, and even then you would probably be better off with getting a 3rd critical item (eg: IE + 2 PDs or IE + PD + Shiv).

{{item:3085}} Applies *on hit* effects; {{champion:29}} {{champion:17}} {{champion:110}} {{champion:429}} passives,  {{item:3115}} {{item:3022}} unique passives, Red buff, Lifesteal etc.
It does **NOT** apply *on attack* effects such as {{champion:51}} Headshot, {{champion:432}} Meeps, {{champion:117}} Pix, or Spellblade procs ({{item:3057}} {{item:3025}} {{item:3078}} {{item:3100}}).

{{champion:22}}'s new passive will be applied by {{item:3085}}, however her new Q's active will not.
I like the changes to her Ultimate Ability. {{champion:22}}
there were no changes tho???
lol
Exactly :P
{{champion:22}} is now even more op than befor LOL!

Ashe was never OP. She was just hard to chase without gap-closers. Other than her kiting ability she had nothing for her. Her damage was very lack-luster but the amount of CC and vision she brings made up for it, as well as her global ult presence in teamfights.
she was OP back in early s1, before gap closers became mandatory
everyone was OP in season 1 has not many summoners knew how to play to the best of there abilities.
Plz explain my ashe penta then

Either it was like most pentas where your team did all the work for you and you just got the last hit, or it was late game Ashe who was truly terrifying with pretty much permanent 100% crit chance and tons of damage.

Late game Ashe has always been reasonable since she can Ult/W/Crit/Crit/Crit/W/Crit a Vayne out of existence no matter how much the Vayne is fed. Losing out on that crit, changes to W, it's going to be a lot harder to get that crit chance (probably build less damage/defense items and more crit) and hope to god it's a safe bot lane. Leona/Graves was hard when Ashe could poke with W, now that she can't use it past a tank/minion wave...

She's so screwed.

She'll continue to be good against champions like Varus, but that's because Varus is also a low mobility champ. Against those matchups then her early game will be a bit stronger, but again less poke so it'll probably even out (though Varus can now Q poke without retaliation), against hard matchups like Graves/Leona she's just stuffed. No poke, no mobility, no defense, ult or die.

> late game Ashe who was truly terrifying with pretty much permanent 100% crit chance

Only if she stops attacking for 8-11 seconds to regain her focus since people would typically build two critical chance items (eg: IE + PD/Shiv) having 50-60% critical chance (depending on runes), and that ain't happening in the middle of a fight.


> Late game Ashe has always been reasonable since she can Ult/W/Crit/Crit/Crit/W/Crit a Vayne out of existence no matter how much the Vayne is fed. Losing out on that crit, changes to W, it's going to be a lot harder to get that crit chance (probably build less damage/defense items and more crit) and hope to god it's a safe bot lane. Leona/Graves was hard when Ashe could poke with W, now that she can't use it past a tank/minion wave...

You don't seem to understand how her new passive and Q will work. She will no longer have a random critical strike chance, instead all of her basic attacks against targets marked by her passive will be classed as critical strikes that deal damage equal to 110% + (Critical Chance x (100 + Critical Damage Bonus) / 100) and with just an IE and PD which gives 55% critical chance will come out to 193%. So that's 7% lower than the normal base critical damage which again will be applied to **all** of her basic attacks on targets that have her passive, and if you build more critical chance to get 100% cap this damage increases to at least 260% (50% IE bonus damage) up until 305.51% if you have all critical damage runes (maximum 95.51% damage with all runes + IE).

Then there is also her Q which with 5 focus stacks will transform her basic attacks to fire 5 arrows at once dealing 27% AD each at max rank, and her passive damage bonus is applied to each individual arrow (unless the target is somehow immune to her passive slow) which with just IE and PD results in 260.55% damage and at 100% critical chance you are looking at 351% (up to 412.44% with all critical damage runes). Her Q lasts for 4 seconds and at max rank gives 40% attack speed, with just Grieves + PD + masteries that's 1.8 attack speed at level 13 and 1.9 at 18 easily allowing for 7 attacks during the 4 seconds Flurry. 

That Vayne has more to worry about from being wiped out from existence by the new Ashe being able to get 7 guaranteed hits of at least 260.55% than the current one who can only get a 1 guaranteed 250% hit with only a chance of more happening randomly with zero guarantee they will and even if they build 100% critical for that guarantee they will only do 250% damage while the new Ashe would be doing at least 351%. And I'm not just doing some theory number crunching here, I have actually tested her on PBE so I know how she works and how my numbers line up against my experiences playing her.

The lack of those potential 200% critical strikes and changes to W might make her early game a bit weaker, which you are really over-dramatising and with the permanent free slow on the passive and the guaranteed extra damage against afflicted targets is debatable if it even will be weaker, it simply means at worst you need to think a bit more about how/when/where you use your W and when to engage or back off from a possible fight.
Maybe {{champion:22}} will have more mana now her frost shot is her passive. But I will miss the old crit bomb you could unleash for quick kills with a shiv to finish the pair
there goes crit sup ashe {{item:3070}}{{item:3070}}
Just like {{champion:103}} , I finally start to main a champ and get used to the their abilities, then Riot "updates" the champ yay
That's just what you get for letting yourself get captured by the Gravemind

now as an ashe player myself, i can see this being a little what people class as over power... but what if what we think is over powered is what riot wants as normal power? 

Anyways i barely used to use volley because i had no mana thanks to frost shot and her ult. I love the fact that her frost shot has being moved. 

I am however sad about the volley only hitting once even if 3-4 arrows hit a target, i believe it should be like a shotgun type of attack, but it isn't and that makes me sad.

I also play Ashe more often than other ADC's and agree with the view that getting hit by multiple volley arrows should mean more damage. 

If you go in to tank the ability and defend the team from volley fire the punishment should reflect that you took multiple hits

How do you justify any other outcome? "Oh I got hit by 4 arrows but it's ok because 3 of them were illusions. Illusions that if they'd hit anyone else would have caused considerable harm, but illusions never-the-less."

I don't understand why they changed her critical hits.  I appreciate utility a lot, but it still seems to take away from her damage

I dunno, I might be completely wrong.  I'll know when I play her

Having just tested her a few times on PBE I don't think this change in critical strikes takes away from her damage, it's just been shifted into more reliable forms.

Firstly her passive gives her attacks higher damage, increased by critical chance and damage, on targets afflicted by her passive which with just an Infinity Edge and Phantom Dancer gives her attacks on such targets 193% AD damage. This gives her higher consistent damage throughout a fight than the normal random critical strikes give.

Secondly her 5-stack Q changes her attacks for 4 seconds to fire 5 arrows at once which at max rank will deal 29% AD each (135% total), and each individual arrow applies the passive bonus damage on its own which with the IE + PD mentioned above will increase their damage 55.97% each and 252.88% or 279.85% in total (depending if the target already had Ashe's passive applied for the first shot or not). Her Q also increases her attack speed by 60% at max rank, with just PD + Grieves + masteries that's 1.75686/1.867404/2.02664 attack speed at levels 9/13/18. This gives the potential for at most 7-8 attacks if lucky, easily at least 5-6, with guaranteed 252.88%/279.85% damage each compared to the 5-8 random chances for normal critical strikes to happen at 250% damage with the same attack speed.

So really it isn't taking away from her damage, her burst has just been shifted out from her normal attacks into her skills while her normal attacks have been empowered to compensate for their lack of burst. Her overall damage will be higher before you even factor in her Q burst, and greatly so when you do factor it in.
Next will be {{champion:78}} like come on you guys have forgotten about her right?

Now Ashe has burst damage besides her ultimate and volley.
And this raises more questions;
Does levelling the Q still scale the effectiveness of the slow?
And are the extra strikes like Yi's double strike, applying on hit effects and building static shiv charges?
I hope so.
Runnans. Bork. Wits. Hey, the new Black Cleaver with its new rage effect.
The Kiting Utility ADC got some new arrows.
This may change bot lane forever...

Nah. No mobility means hard match ups like Graves/Leona are still going to hurt, except this time she can't poke with W. Unless the passive damage is high, it's going to hurt her late game, with the only bonus of helping her early game but if she's in range to auto poke then she's in range for Leona to dive her and Graves to kill her.

And if she goes Hurricane/BotRK/BC/Wits, then she's losing crit at which point she's losing passive damage at which point you may as well play Cait or Kalista since they're actually good at AS builds.

I'd just about play Ashe as a support now, but again with the no W poke she's going to be a hard support. Maybe duo top? Mid? I might take her mid, Vlad top, that sort of team comp and try to hold out for late game.
ashe op
as he update so op
that new passive looks to be a bit OP

This is probably the coolest thing you could have done with the most boring adc in the game.

Also Riot when will she be due?
Now {{champion:22}} isn't just the op "noob" champ that i get ridiculed for playing (she's the only adc i can really play). that's nice.

LIKE WHAT ABOUT AN ATTACK SPEED BOOST OR MOVEMENT SPEED BOOST OR I DUNNO AN EMPOWERED AUTO?> IDC EITHER WAY. I'M GOING OT HAVE TO PLAY GP/TF IF I WANT GOLD BONUS NOW. THANKS RITO :(
Now Ashe's permaslow doesn't cost mana. Oh boy, they've done goofed on this one.

Leona Graves bot lane, Lee Sin jungle, Ahri mid.

Like anyone gives a damn. :P

I don't ranked often, I dislike the AFK's, the trolls, just the sheer level of angst... But when I see an Ashe on the opposite team picked early, I break out the twenty odd year old scotch because I just got a guaranteed win (only twenty odd, I don't care how good the LoL game is, it's not $5000+ a bottle good).

Fizz mid, Kalista/Sona bot, Nocturne jungle. There are so many ways you can pick Ashe out of existence.

Ashe is only a real problem when they're last pick and you have a team without a single gap closer or ranged hard CC but that's on your team for creating an environment where Ashe can do her thing. Alistair sup? Amumu/Sej/Mal jungle? Even champions who are vulnerable to being kited like Vlad can just buy Boots of Swiftness and Rylai's and Ashe is now screwed as she can't out sustain a Vlad and she also can't get away.

I like Annie and Ashe, but Annie is a lot more reliable since she has hard CC which is reasonably reliable, and really high burst. Ashe has soft CC and for most of the game she has pretty low burst, so she can't instakill anyone, but she also can't stun and run. Once you start picking according to your team comp rather than what you're individually comfortable with then Ashe is a lot less scary.

Does your team have hard CC? If no, pick someone with that. Does your team have a gap closer? If no and you're AD, pick Cait, Kalista, Graves, Ezreal, someone who can ignore soft CC. If jungler, Jarvan, Zac, Lee Sin, Malphite (his gap closer is also hard cc and on a low enough CD that you can use it reasonably reliable, his Q is soft CC as well and a decent poke so it's still good against Ashe), Sej, Amumu, etc. Is your team all AD and you're jungler? Karthus or Fid. Pick according to what your team needs rather than what you like, and you will win a lot more games. Maybe, trolls and AFK's will still make you cry. C'est la LoL.

ffs Ashe is already op...

In what meta? Graves/Leona crushes her, any CC crushes her, any burst crushes her. The only people she was OP against were people she could kite, like Varus, and if you picked Varus into Vlad then you kind of deserved to get wasted.

Although even then Varus could auto/auto/auto/ability and really chunk Ashe for most of the game, while Q poking from further range than Ashe could, the balance only changed mid-late game when Ashe really got going but if it was a diving/ganking jungler then she was screwed anyway. Any jungler who had a gap closing ability crushed her, Lee Sin, Nocturne, etc, because the slows just didn't matter.

Same as now. She'll be powerful when it's just her and her opponent, if her opponent is a low mobility champion. Against a high mobility champion (Graves, Kalista, Ezreal, etc) or CC/divy support (Leona, Alistair, Sona, etc), she's going to get wasted. She can't even W poke through minions or past tanks, and only one arrow is going to hit opponents which means no W burst/poke.

She's still going to be hard mode in good matchups, against bad matchups it's going to become impossible. Unless that passive damage is just off the wall but that makes her unreliable as it'll be a prime target to get nerfed if the perception is from opponents that it's too powerful.
